intro: Flickingeria crenicristata, commonly known as the narrow-ribbed cress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly China. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers and alternate, pinnately compound leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Flickingeria crenicristata is often found in rocky or clay soils and is known for its ability to thrive in cool, temperate climates.
